New Records: India posted the highest total at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in Antigua with 196 runs for the loss of 5 wickets
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli got out trying to hit a slower ball for six
Rishabh Pant was caught trying to reverse sweep spinner Rishad Hossain
Hardik Pandya hit the ball with the wind and chose his options well to take India well over par score at the venue
Dube had not done well for the majority of the innings, but hit 3 sixes in the last few balls of his innings to balloon up his score to 34 off 24 balls
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh were on the wrong side at the very start of this game when their captain Najmul Shanto opted to bat first in a day game
Harsha Bhogle, while speaking for the broadcaster said that the pitch was going to get progressively slower as the sun was going to take its toll on the wicket
Post-Match Reflections: With the win, India have one foot into the semi-finals spots with a massive NRR boost
India will qualify for the semi-final if Afghanistan beat Australia on June 23
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kuldeep Yadav really troubled Bangladesh in the match turning and twisting the ball from good length
This was Kuldeep's second game of the tournament, and he has quickly made himself undroppable from the Indian line-up, with 5 wickets from 2 matches
Others: The Indian batting line-up showed incredible intent to score the best-ever total scored in Antigua
Indian bowlers were a class above the Bangladesh batters on the day
